channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: US won't seek death penalty against pair of IS militants
item.description: The US Justice Department says it will not pursue the death penalty against two Islamic State militants suspected of behead Western hostages, removing a hurdle to them facing justice in America.
item.media:description: FILE - In this March 30, 2019, file photo, Alexanda Amon Kotey, left, and El Shafee Elsheikh, who were allegedly among four British jihadis who made up a brutal Islamic State cell dubbed "The Beatles," speak during an interview with The Associated Press at a security center in Kobani, Syria. The Justice Department has notified the British government that it will not pursue the death penalty against two Islamic State militants suspected in the beheadings of Western hostages, removing a hurdle in the potential prosecution of the men in the United States. The decision, revealed in a letter Wednesday, Aug. 19, 2020, could allow Britain to began sharing evidence with federal prosecutors in the U.S for any potential case against El Shafee Elsheikh and Alexanda Kotey. (AP Photo/Hussein Malla, File)

item.title: Ofqual was told its algorithm was 'doomed' a MONTH ago but 'ignored the warnings'
item.description: External advisers had told Ofqual that the formula for deciding the E-level and GCSE results of England's pupils was 'volatile' and ran the risk of producing erratic results, sources said.

item.title: Government U-turn means 1.5million teenagers could get marks equivalent to the old-style A/A*
item.description: The proportion of A/A* equivalent grades to be awarded this year is set to rise by almost 30 per cent, as Education Secretary Gavin Williamson faces widespread calls for him to resign.

item.title: STEPHEN GLOVER: Why I fear Boris Johnson's silence on exam fiasco heaps arrogance upon incompetence
item.description: STEPHEN GLOVER: Where is Boris? We are told he's camping in Scotland with fiancée Carrie Symonds and baby son Wilfred. It's hard to imagine him banging in tent pegs.

item.title: Marcus Rashford and Jesse Lingard could MISS start of Manchester United pre-season
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Marcus Rashford and Jesse Lingard face a nervous wait to discover if they will be forced to cut short a holiday in Greece to avoid a two-week quarantine back in the UK.

item.title: Barack Obama will unload on Donald Trump saying he's lazy and incapable
item.description: Former President Barack Obama is set to deliver his virtual Democratic National Convention speech from the Museum of the American Revolution in Philadelphia.

item.title: Donald Trump demands UN implement full 'snapback' of sanctions on Iran
item.description: The insistence on snapping back international sanctions against Iran sets the stage for a contentious dispute. It's possible that the U.S. call will be ignored by other U.N. members

item.title: Online grocery shopping by over-55s increases by more than a third
item.description: More than half of British adults aged 55 and over now shop online for their groceries, according to figures released in a new report by Waitrose.

item.title: Doctors are told to be frank with patients who have obesity to save taxpayers millions
item.description: Instead of persuading their patients to lose weight, UK doctors are taking the easy way out and prescribing expensive 'bariatric' equipment to assist the chronically heavy with everyday living.

item.title: A coronavirus vaccine could be widely available in the US by APRIL
item.description: Dr Moncef Slaoui told Business Insider a shot could be ready between April and June, which he believes will make it possible to life to return to some semblance of normality by late 2021.

item.title: Death on the Nile: Kenneth Branagh
item.description: Kenneth Branagh is back as the legendary Detective Hercule Poirot to suss out an all-new killer from a crop of famous famous in the first trailer for Death on the Nile, which dropped on Wednesday.

item.title: I worked on murder cases, then my brother was shot dead: Met police officer whose sibling was killed
item.description: Khafi Kareem's 20-year-old brother Alex was shot dead as he left a west London shop. Yet Khafi, a Metropolitan police officer, said that people assumed his death was 'more than a random act of violence.'

item.title: Up to 84% of Facebook posts with medical misinformation do not have 'false content' warning labels
item.description: Report found 84% of Facebook posts with false medical information have gone unlabeled to warn users of the misleading content. These posts have had over 3 billion views in the last year.

item.title: The Femail Face-off: Should working out in the park be banned?
item.description: Kitty Dimbleby says NO, 'we should encourage people, not shame them' while Julie Burchill says YES, 'these gym morons have more hench than sense'.

item.title: Everyday Ageism: FEMAIL columnist CHRISTA D'SOUZA, asks will theatre ever return to the way it was?
item.description: It's the last tolerated prejudice. But Femail's had enough. It's time we called out those day-to-day moments when we're patronised for no longer being young...

item.title: Toxic air may CAUSE asthma in children: It could be a trigger for the condition, research shows
item.description: A study published in the British Medical Journal has show children who grow up with high levels of dirt in the air are more likely to get asthma.

item.title: ABBA's Dancing Queen voted Britain's top floor-filler ahead of Come On Eileen and It's Raining Men
item.description: ABBA's Dancing Queen has been voted the best ever song to dance to. The Swedish group heads a list of the 20 greatest dance floor-fillers of all time beating Beyonce, Queen and Marvin Gaye.

item.title: NHS contact tracing app 'is unlikely to reduce the spread of Covid-19'
item.description: A new study by University College London found that these types of tracking apps only work if the vast majority of a population install and actively use them.

item.title: Women who have a premature baby are twice as likely to die young, new study suggests
item.description: The greater risk of death is highest in the first decade after birth but it persists for up to 40 years, researchers led by the Swedish Research Council found.

item.title: From red carpet to real life...SUSANNA REID: Results week was like a slow motion car crash
item.description: SUSANNA REID: Round two of results in our house, and this morning my GCSE son will receive his grades. There will be no algorithm, no complex ranking of classmates, no computer saying no.

item.title: Modern royals including Prince Harry and Meghan Markle will not feature in The Crown
item.description: Creator of The Crown, Peter Morgan, revealed modern royals such as the Duke and Duchess of Sussex will not feature in the final two series of the drama as there was not 'enough distance'.

item.title: Man claiming to be 'racist attack' victim 'floored man with punch'
item.description: Ahmad Hassan, 27, claimed he was told by a police officer to 'chill out or I'll choke you' during a 'racist' arrest on Sunday in Halifax, West Yorkshire.

item.title: Harry Redknapp oversees a fleet of removal men as they pack up his £7m four-storey Sandbanks mansion
item.description: Harry Redknapp watched on as a fleet of removal men moved him and wife Sandra out of their 'Millionaires Row' mansion in Dorset on Wednesday.

item.title: California reeling from more than 20 wildfires after 10,849 lightning strikes
item.description: At least 23 large wildfires are blazing across the state California, forcing tens of thousands to evacuate amid a historic heat wave.

item.title: Air Canada passenger wakes up to find the window he was sleeping against had a huge CRACK in it
item.description: Karl Haddad, 20, was flying from Toronto to Montreal. He immediately fell asleep, but soon woke up to notice part of his window was open, with the plastic around the glass showing a big crack.

item.title: Man who was haranguing rail staff for not wearing masks is knocked unconscious
item.description: Police are investigating after a passenger who was arguing with Clapham Junction staff about face masks was knocked out by a man in a grey hoodie.

item.title: Cuff justice! Police officer is forced to call 999 for help getting out of his handcuffs
item.description: Northamptonshire Police sergeant Scott Renwick had to call the fire service to release him from a pair of handcuffs after he got stuck in them during a demonstration.

item.title: Scottish teacher launches campaign to be reunited with his wife after being thrown out of China
item.description: Martin O'Brien, from Scotland, was held in solitary confinement in a bare jail cell and interrogated before being kicked out of China and separated from his wife.

item.title: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: John Terry is slide-tackled over plans to build a garage for his supercars
item.description: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: Few will ever emulate John Terry's enviable life path - from beginnings in Barking, Essex, to captain of the England football team and a £40million fortune.

item.title: Golden State Killer's ex-fiancee stares him down from the front row during surprise court appearance
item.description: Bonnie Ueltzen, left, was in court for day two of Joseph DeAngelo's, right, sentencing hearing Wednesday. She was engaged to DeAngelo in the early 1970s before breaking it off.

item.title: Skirt suits to mix & match: The new 'soft' power dressing is professional - but never prim
item.description: FEMAIL's Jess Wood picks out the power skirt suits for your return to the office. The skirt suit is back, but not as we know it. It's relaxed, and it's hardly a 'suit' at all, since it doesn't match.

item.title: Diplomatic row looms after Briton who was jailed for drug crimes in Singapore is caned 24 times
item.description: Ye Ming Yuen, 31, who went to £41,000-a-year Westminster School, was strapped to a large wooden trestle before being caned 24 times at Changi Prison in Singapore yesterday.

item.title: I met boys from Sudan on a beach nearby. There's only one word on their lips - England
item.description: The Sudanese young man who drowned trying to paddle a 'toy blow-up boat' to England with a shovel as an oar was following a dream shared by hundreds of African boys living in Calais, writes SUE REID.

item.title: New BTEC results chaos as board AXES plans to announce grades tomorrow with just 18 hours notice
item.description: The shock 11th-hour move affects 450,000 pupils in the UK, all due to collect results tomorrow morning along with GCSE candidates.

item.title: 'Morning people' who wake up early at higher risk of Alzheimer's
item.description: A team from Imperial College London studied over half a million individuals and analysed their genetic information as well as sleeping patterns.

item.title: Is moon bathing howling mad? Not according to a new book on harnessing its energy
item.description: CLAUDIA CONNELL tries out a 'moonbathing' ritual in her garden with a picnic rug and candles, following the teachings of a new book - Luna by Tamara Driessen. Here's what she discovered...

item.title: Swansea City becomes highest profile football team to ditch gambling company from shirts
item.description: Swansea City, which finished sixth in the Championship - the tier below the Premier League - will replace online betting firm Yobet with Swansea University as its main shirt sponsor.

item.title: Sudanese migrant, 16, dies trying to cross Channel to Britain
item.description: The teenager got into difficulty in the sea on Tuesday night and is thought to have fallen into the water while attempting to cross the Channel. He was discovered near Calais this morning.

item.title: What to wear this weekend: FEMAIL picks out the big dresses of the season
item.description: FEMAIL's Fashion editor Camilla Ridley-Day pics out the 'It' dresses of the season...oversized, relaxed, blowsy dresses that have become this season's defining shape.

item.title: 'Islamist' Iraqi causes multiple crashes on Berlin motorway, injuring six
item.description: Sarmad A, 30, a refugee from Iraq, posted an image of himself standing next to a car on Facebook on Tuesday evening - just hours before it was used to run down three bikers on a highway in Berlin.

item.title: Bride is being THREATENED by her bridesmaid over canceled wedding
item.description: The unnamed bride shared her story on Reddit's 'Am I The A**hole' forum, explaining that the bridesmaid 'used to be a friend of her husband'.

item.title: Meet the hairlarious canine chameleon whose shaggy locks make him resemble a variety of celebrities
item.description: Belinda Rae, 49, from Cumbria, has transformed her furry friend Finn, the sprocker spaniel, into everyone from Tina Turner to Strictly star Claudia Winkleman using his human-like locks.

item.title: Three defiant mothers dare to say...Why we let our children DRINK
item.description: Careful parents Clare, 41, a part-time administrator, and Rob, 38, a diver, have no qualms about allowing their children to drink alcohol. In fact, they've been having the odd tipple since the age of eight.

item.title: Tributes are laid for elderly couple who were found dead after an explosion at their country cottage
item.description: The elderly couple, named locally as Sue and Paul, were found dead in a garage at their home in Cranberry, Staffordshire. Flowers were laid in tribute outside the house.

item.title: Say so long cellulite in just 8 weeks! Beauty guru Kate Shapland shares revolutionary advice...
item.description: Kate Shapland, 56, British founder of leg-care brand Legology promises results in eight weeks following her plan. The plan includes avoiding sugar, starch and practicing body brushing and massage.

item.title: Wonder treatments in your own kitchen cupboard that could help you stay healthy
item.description: From easing eczema with porridge oats to whitening your teeth with sage and treating sore eyes with fennel - the Mail reveals the other. sometimes very surprising, natural medicines at home.

item.title: Parents in desperate search for a bone marrow donor to help their ten-month-old son
item.description: Ten-month-old Reign Miller-Hardy, from Barry, Wales, was diagnosed with a genetic disease known as hemophagocytic lymphohistiocytosis (HLH) earlier this month.

item.title: Storm Ellen SAVAGES summer: 900-mile wide tempest with 75mph gales hits UK
item.description: The storm, which contains the remnants of Tropical Storm Kyle, brought heavy gales as it hit Ireland before dominating the UK for the rest of the week.

item.title: HSBC shoots down Bank of England's optimism over the economy
item.description: Britain's biggest bank has slashed its own expectations for the UK's economic recovery, putting it at loggerheads with the Bank of England's chief economist Andy Haldane.

item.title: BlackBerry smartphone to be revived by Texas startup in 2021
item.description: Texas-based startup OnwardMobility acquired the license for BlackBerry and announced the release of a 5G model in 2021. The smartphone is set to include the iconic physical keyboard.

item.title: Woman dies after being trapped under boat following collision
item.description: The woman, who is in her 30s and from London, died after becoming trapped under a boat which crashed into a wall along the River Bure in Great Yarmouth, Norfolk, today.

item.title: Japanese drinkers sleep in street after heavy alcohol sessions
item.description: Take a walk around Okinawa, southern Japan, at night and you may stumble upon revellers snoring in flowerbeds, on pavements - and even in the middle of the road.

item.title: Gavin Williamson is 'on his last life' after his exams fiasco
item.description: The warnings came as calls for the Education Secretary to resign continue to grow, just weeks before schools in England are due to return full-time in September.

item.title: Wellcome Prize 2020: Photo account of depression battle wins
item.description: Uzbekistan-born photographer Arseniy Neskhodimov created the collection, called Prozac, at his parents' house and in Sharm el Sheikh, Egypt. The series explores his experience of depression.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Charity sector loses 25k jobs with 35k at risk
item.description: In a survey of 455 UK charities 19 per cent have already made redundancies with a further 23 per cent planning to make more cutbacks once the furlough scheme ends.

item.title: Tess Holliday hits out over 'hatred' of 'fat people' after strawberry dress goes viral
item.description: Holliday, 35, took to social media to share photos and videos of herself wearing the pink tulle frock by designer Lirika Matoshi to the Grammys in January.

item.title: Calls to lift cap on number of medical students in UK
item.description: Universities have been inundated with calls from students who now have higher grades and are want to start their new course at their first choice in September.

item.title: Women pose TOPLESS on public hiking trails in growing trend
item.description: The topless hiking trend has been growing over the past several years. Women get to a scenic spot, mostly at mountain summits, and take off their tops for pictures - either alone or with friends.

item.title: Humans 'can instinctively tell if a snake is venomous'
item.description: Photos of venomous snakes elicit stronger fear responses, such as sweating and increased heart rate, than images of non-venomous ones, Czech scientists found.

item.title: Matt Hancock suggests 'no excuse' for people not to return to their desks
item.description: The Health Secretary said official data showed 'very largely' the disease is being passed on when one household meets with another 'usually in one of their homes'.

item.title: Perfect for dodging the jams! Engineer converts £30 fairground bumper car into 8mph road vehicle
item.description: Chris Acock, 53, created the distinctive two seater by merging an old fairground car with a mobility scooter. He now frequently turns heads when driving it on the streets of Portland, Dorset.

item.title: 'Step bridge' spans gorge above Norway's Voringsfossen waterfall
item.description: The Voringsfossen waterfall plunges nearly 600ft from the Hardangervidda plateau to the Mabodalen valley. A 154ft-long bridge over its torrents will open on Friday.

item.title: Ice age dog ate woolly rhino and died in landslide 14k years ago
item.description: A reanalysis of an pup that lived 14,000 years ago, reveals its last meal was a woolly rhinoceros. Experts first found the ancient canine in 2011 but recently discovered the specimen that still had its yellow fur.

item.title: Premier League is hit by FOURTEEN new positive coronavirus tests at 12 pre-season training camps
item.description: There has been a spike in positive coronavirus cases since Premier League players returned for pre-season training last weekend. A total of 14 cases have been recorded at 12 clubs.

item.title: Man wraps car in CELLOPHANE after woman blocks driveway
item.description: Tobe Bailey, 49, from Margate, Kent, wrapped his neighbour's blue Vauxhall Corsa in black cellophane after she blocked his driveway for more than a day.

item.title: Faking a smile tricks the brain into feeling happier
item.description: Experts from the University of South Australia found the physical task of smiling activates specific muscles in a person's cheeks and this triggers happy emotions in the brain.

item.title: VisitEngland Awards: England's best places to eat, sleep and go
item.description: The winners of the 2020 VisitEngland Awards for Excellence were selected from hundreds of tourism businesses across England and were announced at a virtual awards ceremony.

item.title: Durham University offers bursaries to students who defer entry
item.description: Durham University, recently rated the 11th best university in the country, says it will provide students with accommodation and a bursary to 'help with their transition to university life'.

item.title: Prison diversity officer, 51, 'had inappropriate relationship with inmate at Wormwood Scrubs'
item.description: Ex-HMP Wormwood Scrubs officer Pamela Belonwu, 51, entered into the relationship with inmate Clifton Thomas while he was at the prison in White City, Isleworth Crown Court heard.

item.title: Mother tells how her heart 'snapped' after hearing her daughter was killed in Manchester bombing
item.description: Hashem Abedi, 23, was found guilty of 22 counts of murder, attempted murder and plotting to cause an explosion likely to endanger life after the Manchester Arena attack in 2017.

item.title: Apple is first US company worth over $2tn after stock rose 60%
item.description: Apple shares have gained nearly 60 percent this year as the company overcame the shutdown of factories in China that produce the iPhone and the closure of its retail sales amid the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Lori Loughlin told daughter not to talk to high school counselor
item.description: In a sentencing memorandum filed in court in Massachusetts on Thursday, prosecutors once again described how the pair cheated the system.

item.title: Pop fans pay tribute at funeral of Primal Scream singer Denise Johnson, 56
item.description: Johnson was born and raised in Hulme, Manchester, and shot to fame for her work on Primal Scream's critically acclaimed 1991 album Screamadelica.

item.title: Sweden's coronavirus expert warns that wearing masks is 'very dangerous'
item.description: Anders Tegnell, chief epidemiologist at Sweden's Public Health Agency, has expressed scepticism that face masks will control Covid-19 outbreaks.

item.title: Say cheese! Mayans and modern-day people used the same facial expressions
item.description: A study by researchers from California has found that modern-day people can still recognise the emotions of those living up to 3,500 years ago.

item.title: Tiny Robo-beetle is powered by liquid methanol-fuelled 'muscles'
item.description: Roboticists from California developed the bug-sized 'RoBeetle' - which weighs in at less than 1/100th of an ounce - to explore new means of propelling tiny machines.

item.title: Perfectionists and their high standards cause family issues
item.description: A study carried out by a team from the SWPS University of Social Sciences and Humanities in Poland found women often expect perfection from their partners, and men from their children.

item.title: Britain's 'oldest artwork' revealed: Markings found on Ice Age stones in Jersey
item.description: Archaeologists from Newcastle University and the Natural History Museum examined the artistic designs on rocks found at Les Varines in Jersey between 2014 and 2018.

item.title: Parents of trans children praise CBBC for airing series about a 12-year-old transgender girl
item.description: Transgender teen Evie Macdonald stars as Hannah Bradford in First Day, a four-part Australian-made drama about a trans girl starting secondary school.

item.title: 'Oldest film in existence' remastered with AI
item.description: YouTuber Denis Shiryaev has posted a new version of the legendary video on his site, which is now in 4K quality at around 250 frames per second.

item.title: Celebrity photographer's autistic son 'suffocated with a sponge'
item.description: The murdered autistic son of a celebrity photographer died after being suffocated with a sponge - a court appearance of his accused killer mother heard this morning

item.title: NEU demands reduced content for A-levels and GCSEs in 2021 as students find tests 'too stressful'
item.description: Bosses at the National Education Union (NEU), the UK's largest teaching union, have written to Education Secretary Gavin Williamson, warning coronavirus spikes could lead to 'loss of schooling'.

item.title: Man, 33, stabbed partner's ex-boyfriend to death after iPad row
item.description: Robert Parkins, 33, knifed a 'loving and devoted father' Alex Fitzpatrick, 30, 15 times in the neck and chest outside the home of his former partner Kelly Anderson in St Neots, Cambridgeshire.

item.title: 'Heart strands' drawn by Leonardo da Vinci finally understood
item.description: An international team of researchers found the mesh-like trabeculae in the heart improves the blood flow efficiency through the organ.

item.title: Glee's Dianna Agron and Mumford And Sons' Winston Marshall split
item.description: Former Glee star Dianna Agron has reportedly splits from her Mumford And Sons husband Winston Marshall after almost four years of marriage.

item.title: 10,000 NHS workers sign up to take part in study into Covid reinfection
item.description: Public Health England researchers will follow volunteers for at least a year, regularly swabbing them for the virus and taking blood samples to search for antibodies.

item.title: China's 'folding girl', 23, can finally walk upright thanks to life-changing surgery
item.description: The young woman from China, billed by media as the 'folding girl', underwent four operations in three months to fix her hunched back. She can now stroll with the help of a walking frame.

item.title: White Tube racist knocked unconscious hands self in to police
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Billy Steele, 31, who was filmed launching the shocking tirade on a Central Line tube, is understood to work for the family-owned business S&S Steel Fixing Limited.

item.title: Fresh UK quarantine fears for Croatia as daily coronavirus cases increase
item.description: Croatia has seen an upsurge in the past week and today posted cases that almost match the highest in August. It will fuel speculation that the air bridge may go as early as this week.

item.title: New Zealand's High Court rules the lockdown was UNLAWFUL - with people wrongly forced to stay home
item.description: Jacinda Ardern's decision to place the country into level four lockdown on March 26 was a breach of parliamentary law dating back to the 1990s.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: 15 fatalities in preliminary daily death toll
item.description: A full round-up of the total number of fatalities - which will include all settings in England and not just hospitals - will be published later by the Department of Health.

item.title: Songbirds sing loudest at dawn 'to warm their voices up' for day
item.description: Researchers from Duke University in North Carolina believe songbirds start singing at dawn to prepare their vocal cords for a day filled with performing.

item.title: Universities need £3BILLION: IFS warns of soaring costs of giving cash to top institutions
item.description: Top universities have called on the Government for additional funds to take on more students and for the cap on pupils studying medicine to be lifted amid fears ministers face £3billion bailout

item.title: German law forces dog owners to take hour-long walks with pets
item.description: Agriculture Minister Julia Klöckner will introduce new legislation in Germany's Dogs Act to ensure people take their animals for substantial walks.

item.title: 'Reverse cow girl' searched for by Britons more than 60,000 times in the last month
item.description: Searches for positions which do not require face-to-face contact have increased in numbers compared to before the virus struck, research by UK-based End of Tenancy London shows.

item.title: Ghost town London's £5.7BILLION black hole: Taxpayers face bill as lost fares leave TfL £3.5bn short
item.description: The coronavirus pandemic has left the Greater London area with an estimated £5.7billion black hole in its public finances - after the lockdown and work from home economy sapped £575million a day

item.title: Stripper dislocated fellow dancer's shoulder during glass attack at gentleman's club, court hears
item.description: Samantha Gavin, 44, is charged with the assault on victim Ella Eaton inside Black Cherry in Worcester on October 12 last year after Ms Eaton was left with a torn earlobe and dislocated shoulder.

item.title: How children have become a 'status symbol' for gay men: Filmmaker claims there's a 'pressure'
item.description: Israeli filmmaker Yuval Hadadi told Air Mail that there is a 'pressure and expectation' for gay men to become fathers, adding: ''Children have in a way become a status symbol among many gay men.'

item.title: Support for Scottish independence hits record high of 55% - the exact REVERSE of the 2014 referendum
item.description: Backing for a breakaway has hit 55-45 in favour, as the Scottish First Minister continues to take advantage of the Prime Minister's flailing handling of the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Fears teachers could be blamed for giving ACCURATE GCSE results when they are released tomorrow
item.description: Teachers who give accurate GCSE results 'could be blamed,' by parents and pupils for not inflating their grades, a former headteacher has warned.

item.title: Row of three country cottages in Wales on sale for £200,000
item.description: The historic terraced buildings, described as 'unusual' by the estate agents, are set in remote Wales in the village of Ponterwyd, near Aberystwyth, and were once a village surgery.

item.title: Royal Navy scrambles to intercept fleet of NINE Russian warships spotted in waters close to UK
item.description: An operation carried out alongside NATO allies saw offshore patrol vessels HMS Mersey and HMS Tyne join Type 23 frigate Westminster in monitoring 'every movement' of the Russian fleet.

item.title: Air pollution from diesel cars is 23% worse outside of London's ultra-low emissions zone
item.description: Concentrations of toxic nitrogen oxides (NOx) gases from diesel are worst in five London locations, all outside the ULEZ, reveals EDF Europe.

item.title: Property tycoon Nick Candy selling £54m 63-metre superyacht
item.description: British billionaire Candy, 47, put his stunning vessel on the market having owned it for five years. The father-of-two tycoon bought it in 2015 and immediately gave it an art-deco style makover.

item.title: EU announces sanctions for high-ranking officials responsible for brutal crackdown in Belarus
item.description: European Council President Charles Michel said that the August 9 election - which saw 80 percent support for the strongman leader - was 'neither free nor fair.'

item.title: Insulin-producing pancreatic cells could treat type 1 diabetes
item.description: A new study from the Salk Institute found that adding two proteins to the beta-like cells 'turbo-charged' them to produce insulin and kept the immune system from attacking them.

item.title: Man, 37, is arrested in north Surrey on suspicion of right-wing terror offences
item.description: Detectives from the Met's Counter Terrorism Command made the dawn raid on the address in north Surrey under section 41 of the Terrorism Act 2000.

item.title: JANET STREET-PORTER: Shouldn't we be asking whether Mickey Mouse degrees are worth the money?
item.description: JANET STREET PORTER: Our economy is desperate for highly skilled workers, the product of apprenticeships and technical colleges, specialists who will start their own businesses.

item.title: Restaurant slams customer who didn't order for one-star review
item.description: Almost Famous, a burger bar in the Great Northern leisure centre in Manchester, took to Twitter to slam the review on Open Table and its poster, urging other people not to be 'a LeanneM'.

item.title: Two of PC Andrew Harper's killers launch appeal against their manslaughter convictions
item.description: Albert Bowers and Jessie Cole, both 18, have lodged applications with the Court of Appeal to challenge their convictions and their 13-year sentences for killing PC Harper (pictured).

item.title: Top 10 most affordable UK towns to buy a home in
item.description: Three of the five most affordable towns to buy a home in the country are in County Durham, with property prices in top-ranked Shildon coming in at around the £60,000 mark.

item.title: Would YOU let your kids stay glued to screens during dinner out at a fancy restaurant?
item.description: The Saturdays star, 31, admitted to being an 'iPad Mum' on Instagram this week. Here, FEMAIL, speaks to parents who say there's no way they'd let their children have a tablet during a family meal out.

item.title: National Geographic Traveller (UK)'s Photography Competition 2020 finalists revealed
item.description: Launched in 2011, the annual contest seeks to find the UK's best new travel photography talent across four categories: cities, landscape, nature and people.

item.title: Singer is hit by a train and killed while live-streaming himself listening to loud music
item.description: Tavy Pustiu, 29, was killed and his wife, 24, is fighting for her life after a train plunged into their white Ford Fiesta at a level crossing in Ploiesti, Romania.

item.title: 'It's a kick in the teeth': Family of Holby City actor's daughter say she has been 'denied justice'
item.description: The grieving family of the daughter of a Holby City actor who died from an overdose said she has been 'denied justice' after her rapper boyfriend, who gave her the drug and filmed her dying, was freed

item.title: Baby girl looks VERY unimpressed as she tries her first ever mouthful of apple puree
item.description: Daniela Gheorghe and Davide Fabris who live in Greenwich London, shared adorable footage of their then eight month old daughter Bianca Fabris tasting apple puree for the first time.

item.title: China unveils its 1,100lb precision-guided stealth missile 'Sky Thunder' that can drop 240 bombs
item.description: The munitions dispenser and air-to-surface missile was introduced by Chinese state media on Friday. It came amid spiking tensions between Beijing and Washington over the sovereignty of Taiwan.

item.title: Mercedes' £2.4m F1 car for the road is incoming
item.description: Just 275 examples are due to be produced, all of them using the 1.6-litre turbocharged hybrid powertrains lifted straight from Lewis Hamilton's racing machines.

item.title: Stunning British country estate goes on sale for £18.5million
item.description: The 970-acre West Woodyates Manor estate sits just 11 miles south of the cathedral city of Salisbury, Wiltshire, and boats beautiful formal gardens, parkland and a portfolio of cottages.

item.title: Girlfriend shares a photo of her wedding dress on the internet... but she isn't engaged
item.description: An anonymous girlfriend has been criticised for buying a lacy white wedding dress before she's even engaged, saying that it should be a major 'red flag' for her partner.

item.title: Ex-Westminster public schoolboy will be strapped naked to a frame and caned 24 times
item.description: Ye Ming Yuen, 29, an ex-pupil of £37,000-a-year Westminster School is locked up in top-security Changi prison in Singapore for drug offences. He will be caned 24 times.

item.title: Father of British DJ jailed in Singapore says he was too harsh on his ex-public schoolboy son
item.description: London-born Ye Ming Yuen (pictured) has been sentenced to 20 years in jail as well as 24 strokes of the cane after being convicted of seven drug charges in Singapore, including trafficking.
